alert.note: Alert for Anson; Stanly (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 12 at 10:01AM EST until February 13 at 11:17AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... Rocky River Near Norwood affecting Anson and Stanly Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rocky River Near Norwood. * WHEN...From this morning to late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Minor flood stage. There is significant overflow into adjacent pasture and lowlands. At 27.0 feet, The parking lot at the Anson County boat access on the will begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EST Sunday the stage was 20.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM EST Sunday was 20.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 23.0 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Thu Rocky River Norwood 20.0 20.3 Sun 9 am EST 15.1 8.9 7.2 6.6 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued this evening by 1000 PM EST.
